Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable hotel close to the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: AgTaistealGoMinic
Reviews.Content: Close to the Vatican but on a quiet street ensuring a good night's sleep. Great view from the roof terrace. Breakfast was tasty and desk staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were quite old-fashioned and a bit dark but it was clean and comfortable, great sleep quality and a good price for the location - I'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Krun0
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at the Arcangelo Hotel this march. All staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable an clean and breakfast was outstanding. Special compliments for the italian cappuccinos and a fresh squeezed orange juice.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and close to the sights”
Reviews.Author: Gus1970
Reviews.Content: Location: A short walk to Vatican City. We walked to all the other sites as well but if you don't have the energy the Metro line runs close by. Main shopping street just around the corner and a few good restaurants located closy by. Room: Clean and comfortable beds. We stayed in a twin room and it was a little bit pokey but probable better than what you expect for the price and the location. The only issue was trying to regulate the temperature. Breakfast: Standard to what you get at other hotels/B&B around Italy. Sliced meats and cheeses, fresh juice, fruit, toast, eggs etc. Staff: Always willing to assist and happy and friendly. Overall: Would definitely stay there again. The rooftop terrace is a great place to chill out and have a quiet drink.

Reviews.Title: “Vatican City is on the doorstep .........”
Reviews.Author: Carol H
Reviews.Content: Ideal location . The whole of Rome is within walking distance .Vatican City is on the Doorstep . The Dome of St Peters seen and enjoyed from the lovely roof terrace . Immediate neighbourhood has restaurants and little bars/ coffee shops with as many locals as tourists eating there. Interesting local shops. Rooms on the small side , wonderful shower in ensuit. Immaculately kept by the housekeeping team . Desk staff friendly and helpful . Would stay here again .

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet Location in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: marmaduke58
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a quiet part of Rome not far from Vatican City. It has a roof terrace with a great view of the dome of St Peters. The room was comfortable and the breakfast was great. Found the desk staff not the most helful I have come across which is a shame but this would not stop me staying here again. A coach runs from termianl 3 at Flumicino Airport to the Piazza Cavour which is five minutes walk to the hotel, it costs 8 euro per person and includes luggage. The coach web site is www.sitbusshuttle.it If you want a good restaurant near the hotel then turn right out of the hotel front entrance and walk about four blocks on Via Ennio Quirino Visconti to the Al Palazzaccio Restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet comfort near Vatican City”
Reviews.Author: Lewismor
Reviews.Content: We arrived early on Tuesday and were able to store our luggage until check in. A can was called and promptly arrived to take us to St Peters. The Concierge was delightful and charming, the dining room was excellent as was the breakfast each day (order the cappucino its delicious!). Our room was a little small but, if you need a clean, quiet, comfortable place to sleep and set out to see the city from its well worth it. The roof patio was lovely and we ended several nights sitting upstairs looking out at the city and the view of the Vatican which was as advertised quite nice. It is a hike to the nearest Metro stop, but a short walk to great food and good shopping. All in all a very worthwhile hotel that we would return to any time!

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Grafstout
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Arcangelo for three days. It was a fifteen minute walk to the Vatican. Five minutes to restaurants. They were helpful in planning excursions as well as Taxis. Very nicely decorated rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for a good price.”
Reviews.Author: kadoki
Reviews.Content: This property is very close to the Vatican and within easy walking distance of the subway. They offer a great breakfast with pastries, yogourt, fruit, deli meat, cheese, boiled egg, etc. There is also a very nice rooftop patio for relaxing after a long day of walking. The service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel. would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: stonfix
Reviews.Content: the hotel is located on a nice area, near castelo sant'angelo and the vatican. not so close to other main attractions, but fun thing about rome is walking and you also have the subway 5 blocks away. there´s not much action around the area, but i´d rather be in that area than in the over populated and noisy center of the city. rooms are small but confortable and clean, so is the bathroom. wi fi works great and the breakfast is very decent. very nice value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Arcangelo is a mainstay of any visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: km0722
Reviews.Content: Hotel Arcangelo has been a favorite of mine since 1991 when my husband and I first found it and stayed on our honeymoon. We have returned there each time we are in Rome and we have brought friends and family with us. The service has always been of the highest quality and we enjoy the breakfast and the solarium. The solarium is our second favorite amenity after the breakfast; you can enjoy the view, have a glass of wine or a bite of bread and cheese and relax before going out for an evening or going to bed. We recommend the Arcangelo to everyone going to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: dleng
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at Hotel Arcangelo, absolutely loved the location, easy walking distance to the Vatican, and many other sights. The continental breakfast was more than adequate to get your day going. We liked the meat tray and fresh pastries every morning, however they could have do better with the coffee. The staff and the main desk personnel were very pleasant and helpful with any question we may have had. Really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: -Honey-32123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Arcangelo for four nights in July. The hotel was on a quiet street with a nice roof top garden. It was very close to the Vatican City (5 minute walk). Pros: - quiet rooms - good breakfast (pastries, eggs, bread, cereal, juice, coffee, yoghurt, etc.) - friendly staff - close to lots of shops and restaurants - clean Cons: - longer walk to major attractions like the Colosseum and Trevi Fountain (This didn't bother us as it only took about 30 minutes to walk it and there were many amazing things to see along the way) - small bathroom with extremely small shower (even by European standards) - bed was a bit small Saint Peter's was our favourite part of Rome, so this was a great hotel for us. It allowed us to get to the Vatican early before the 2 to 3 hour lines started to form.

Reviews.Title: “a big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: umteacher
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my son and his wife, based on the reviews on this site. It's location is great-close to the Vatican, but there were other major problems with it. The double room they'd booked was not available at check-in, so they were put into two single rooms. The hotel did offer to put them up the first night in another hotel, but refused to pay the taxi fare there and back (15 euros one way). The air-conditioning was also not working, so there was a portable air conditioner in the room. Sounds good, except that whenever they used it, the power would go off, and they'd have to call the main desk to switch the breaker back on. Given the fact that the temperature was in the mid 30's (Celcius), it made for very uncomfortable nights. The elevator was also not working on the last day. It was not a hotel they would want to go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: cyber7
Reviews.Content: Nicely appointed hotel - selected due to its proximity to the Vatican. Decor of rooms different , could be called stuffy , but nice for a change. Staff very helpful and friendly. Good selection for breakfaxt buffet.

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon trip!”
Reviews.Author: Roman413
Reviews.Content: people that worked there very nice and helpful! spoke good English, very clean, rooms where a little small, but when your in Italy i hope you just sleep in your room an get out to see the sights, good location,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel/Good proximity”
Reviews.Author: barkologist
Reviews.Content: 3 of us stayed 5 nights in Rome (2 rooms/ 1 double and 1 single) and chose Hotel Arcangelo based solely on TripAdvisor reviews for its convenience, value, breakfast and proximity to Vatican and many other sites. The hotel was attractive, nicely appointed, very quiet and all the staff we encountered were most pleasant and helpful. The breakfast was plentiful and the coffee (although a dispenser machine) was quite good. The rooftop sitting area was attractive and good for taking your own wine and snacks up to in the late afternoon & evening. We would absolutely stay here again. the price quoted on the internet was the exact price we paid upon our departure. So pleased with that.

Reviews.Title: “perfect base for visiting Rome”
Reviews.Author: Magic_Muppet
Reviews.Content: I'm so surprised by the negative feedback on here - I had a wonderful stay at the Arcangelo. It is perfectly situated for the Vatican, a mere 15 mins or so metro ride from Termini and in a lovely, quiet, safe (or so it felt) area of Rome - quite residential (which is nice) and there are lots of little local restaurants and bars nearby. We each had single rooms, they weren't massive, but I was more than happy as all I want when sightseeing is somewhere clean and comfortable to lay my head after a weary day! The bathrooms are superb and have fabulous showers. The roof terrace is a lovely touch - we didn't ever make use of it though as we were always out and about. There was a mix of Italians and foreigners when we were there, mainly early to mid 30s like us. Highly, highly recommended, fabulous value for money, friendly, helpful staff - I will definitely be back there whenever I'm in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hgolsen
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a nine day stay at this hotel, and could not have been happier with our choice. Friendly front desk, clean every where, room, lobby, roof terrace. Room cleaned, linens replaced daily, roof terrace an exceptional place to relax at the end of a busy day, quiet, good neighborhood. A+

Reviews.Title: “Great personal - cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: aberweger
Reviews.Content: It's my second time in this hotel and I can really recommend it. I think it's more a hotel for elder people - at least you don't really see a lot of young people. I've been there for business trips. They have wireless (ask for it), a TV in every room and if you're alone and just for a couple of nights there - you don't need more. The furnishure is a matter of taste. I don't like the red or green walls - but whatever - you're there to sleep and not to stay the whole day in the room - right? The personal is unbeliviable nice. They helped me with everything and they also like to have just a little chat. The breakfast is ok. (I'm not really a breakfast-girl... so don't ask me about this).. A disadvantage is, that you can't get anything to drink (at least nothing hot) or to eat after breakfast. Also the bar was never open during my stays. All in all it's a nice hotel with very friendly personal - in my opinion more for elder guests (I'm 19.. but there were really no other young people). The best of all is of course that it's very in the center. You have just a shopping street, the vatican, Tiber,... next to it! Big plus!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Hotel Near Vatican”
Reviews.Author: yeoldelimelight
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel tucked away right near the Vatican. Friendly staff. Decent-sized rooms. Clean and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Hotel Arcangelo!!”
Reviews.Author: asj224
Reviews.Content: By far our favorite hotel during our 12 day vacation in Italy. The staff went above and beyond, the room was much more spacious then the one we had at the Ara Pacis. The location was great. We were even pleased by the size of the bathroom. We will definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Only so so”
Reviews.Author: ire123
Reviews.Content: I booked a short stay at this hotel only too aware of the mixed reviews on this site. However , I got a great price with BA and the fact that it had a nice-looking roof terrace. On arrival I was shown into a wardrobe like space that turned out to be a bedroom ! I could touch each wall by standing in the middle of the room, it was steaming hot and faced the street. said to the manager who showed me in that it was incedibly small but he shrugged and said that this is a standard single. That night was awful , the bed was miniscule and rock hard and the one pillow provided was about 5 mm thick. I weigh about 120 lbs so I dread to think how anybody larger could have fitted into that bed. The wallpaper was navy stiped which really added to the cell like feel. The following morning , I complained and another desk clerk said , Oh do you want to change rooms ? The next room was heaps better and after that things were fine. However , the first night there were just 4 other guests in the entire hotel , so it was very mean minded to use this tiny room when so many others were available. Th good points were a great roof terrace , excellent location and a decent breakfast.All are only any use if you actually get some sleep the night before. But , beware on those tiny single rooms that really are only suitable if you are aged below 5 years or are not fussed about sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: quidom
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was great, it was all you could want for sightseeing. You would not want to spend hours in the hotel but great for if you wanted somewhere comfy. That said, the beds were a bit hard, but after a night you became accustomed. Another member of our party, in another room, had trouble with noisy aircon (room 25) and was then moved to a room which had an irritatingly bright light (room 37) but room 27 was fine, with excellent aircon, which was not too noisy. The location was perfect, few minutes walk to the Vatican and 10 to central Rome yet the area was almost silent at night. There is a great little trattoria, if you leave the Hotel, turn left and continue to the end of Boezio. Turn left, the first restaurant on the left hand side of the road. Its great serving excellent Pasta and Pizza but try and go in the week when the normal waitress is on as at the weekend the son of the owner serves and is not as good. Expect €40 for 4 mains some salad and a starter. For pudding go left away from Boezio, and straight. You will hit a sort of café stroke gelatia where you should buy ice cream and head down the road. You will be walking down a side street and then you will emerge in the Vatican as if by mistake. From about eight till half past it is almost deserted before the night tours of Rome arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: TO1
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I was quite apprehensive about this hotel. What an incredible surprise. Our room was beautiful, not huge, but this is Europe, not North America. Our room was beautifully decorated with brocade walls. The hotel itself was very clean, our room was very clean, the bathroom was very clean, we had a shower door! One of the men behind the desk was not overly friendly but basically all the staff was fine. We had to leave our passports temporarily. This is because the hotel is required to register all guests with the police. We got our passports back within the hour. I would rate this hotel above the 3-star rating that it has. One must remember that one is in Europe and that our North American standards are different than European ones.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth G
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was scared to death about my Priceline booking at Arcangelo. Breakfast- No ants on the food. It was a great breakfast. Good meats and cheeses. The coffee was very European (dark, bitter, strong). No complaints. Rooms- Comfortable beds. The shower is too small with no shower curtain. That was a problem. The rooms were decorated nicely, but we were never really there. Quiet street, an oasis from the city noise. Staff- 4 different men manned the front desk. 3 were really nice, the morning attendant wasn't too friendly. But they were all very helpful for directions, taxis, train info. They even let me use their internet connection to check my email. I paid $200 a night and consider that a great deal. Close to the vatican, a short walk from the piazzas. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: gmacSarasota
Reviews.Content: I'm not in to review writing, but the recent bashing by some reviewers prompted this effort. We had three rooms and three generations (from 90 to young children) stay at the hotel. None were overly impressed, but all were more than satisfied. The location is very good, particularly if you're interested in the Vatican. We also took the bus and metro, which are only 5-7 blocks from the hotel. We found the staff very accommodating, making cab arrangements and providing directions without hesitation. Unlike another reviewer, I can't imagine leaving a passport at the front desk. I haven't done that since it was required in the former Soviet Union. More germane, we had safes in all rooms, they're just a little hard to find. The rooms were clean and reasonable, but I agree with others that they are a bit drab with minor toilet issues. Renovations were on-going during our stay. The breakfast was more than I expected. Danish, pastry, hard rolls, meats, cheese, hard boiled eggs, corn flakes, juice, coffee, tea and capucchino on request. From my perspective, this wasn't a great hotel, but given the prices today in Rome, it's very good value. Maybe that's because we booked on-line for a 114 euro rate versus others staying in the hotel who paid 150. Unless you want to step up in price class, I don't believe you'll do much better than the Hotel Arcangelo.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing overall”
Reviews.Author: Jeggers
Reviews.Content: First the good aspects. Its in a quiet road and close to St Peter's Square and the Vatican Museum. The bus terminus is only a few minutes walk away, so its easy to get a 15-minute bus to other attractions like the Colosseum. The bad asepcts were: the room was drab, dark and quite small, with basic decorations only. The bathroom is small (only room for one person at a time) and ours had no bath, only a shower. The toilet was dirty, and the cistern water was running into the pan all the time. Despite reporting this to reception this problem was not rectified. The breakfast is basic continental and just about adequate, with tasteless coffee, no choice of cereals. The ham had ants running about on it on some mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: GregComo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I read many positive reviews of the Hotel Arcangelo on trip advisor so we decided to stay here during our recent trip to Italy. I'm not sure if there are multiple Hotel Arcangelo's in Rome or not but we were EXTREMELY disappointed. Rooms were tiny and dirty, we could hear our neighbor snoring through the walls and it was very stuffy. The staff was very unfriendly as well. To top it off, My wife and I decided to leave our passports with the front desk since there were no safes in the room and they told us at check-in that they could store them in the safe at the front desk- BIG MISTAKE. Upon our checkout, when we asked for our passports, they said they never had them. Even worse, the staff tried to turn the tables and tell us that they gave them back to us. They NEVER apologized for the inconvenience and did not even comp us for at least a night's stay. The staff was extremely rude during the whole ordeal. There are plently of great places to stay in Rome - avoid Hotel Arcangelo.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a convenient but non-touristy location so the surrounding streets are quiet at night. However it is a short walk to the Vatican, and about a 20 min walk to Piazza Navona. The train station is about a mile away but one night it closed at 9pm anyway. Some of the hotel staff were helpful but not all of them were. There is a concierge but there is no tourist information at the desk, all we got was a map. One kindly called up train times for us but they were incorrect. Their website says there is an airport shuttle but it is only a special rate they get for a taxi to the airport which costs €60 before 7 am and €48 after 7 am, and they encouraged us to book it without informing us of cheaper options like the express train from Termini. They also say there is internet access but they don't provide the USB port connections. Overall a convenient location, good sized rooms, reasonable price but not all staff are so helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: An excellent holiday, only stayed for a 5 day trip. We found this hotel on the spur of the moment as the hotel we booked through the internet turned out to be a dump. However, on arrival the receptionist was very polite, very helpful and to top it all we got the room cheaper than the original one we booked, bonus!. The hotel itself was very clean and well presented with a marble entrance. It was situated in a good part of the town, away from the touristy bit but close enough to walk into the main parts. There was a high street just round the corner where we found loads of shops to accomodate our ancillery needs, coffee, wine, snacks, gifts, etc. The room was excellent and the solarium was in view of the Vatican (we went there when the Pope popped his clogs, not the intention of the holiday) but served a very relaxing place to sit in late afternoon to early evening with a bottle of wine, excellent. We would definately go back there again, the hotel has a website, just do a google search to find it.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Reasonable Hotel Near the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: sc19
Reviews.Content: For the money, this is a good tourist class hotel. The rooms and bathrooms are spacious, and there is a mini-bar. The staff was quite helpful, if not overly friendly. The breakfast room was quite nice, and the food adequate for a quick bite prior to getting out and about for the day. We found it's location to be quite good, because we could tour during the day, have dinner in the center of town, and then walk just 20 minutes back to our hotel. There are also some restaurants in the area of the hotel, if you prefer to eat closer. We didn't visit the shops in the area, but there were a number of them, including a Coin Department store. Hotels in Rome are quite expensive, and given the relatively lower cost and ambience, I would definitely stay at this one again.

Reviews.Title: “great weekend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had a great weekend. Reception really looked after us. We had a great taxi deal to the airport. Half the price we paid in G.B. Breakfast was adequate and the rooms clean and tidy Will recommend this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Arcangelo
HotelInfo.Address: Via Boezio 15, 00192 Rome, Italy
